context: this is an 81-year-old gentleman who underwent septorhinoplasty many years ago.
preoperative diagnosis: squamous cell carcinoma, left nasal cavity.
he has been complaining of tenderness and induration of his nasal tip for approximately two years
he has been complaining of tenderness and induration of his nasal tip for approximately two years
he has been treated unsuccessfully for folliculitis and cellulitis of the nasal tip.
he has been treated unsuccessfully for folliculitis and cellulitis of the nasal tip.
the left nose was decongested with afrin.
the preoperative examination shows induration of the nasal tip without significant erythema.
there is focal tenderness just cephalad to the alar crease.
there is no lesion either externally or intranasally.
a diagnosis of diffuse invasive squamous cell carcinoma was rendered.
xeroform gauze was then fashioned to cover the defect and was sutured along the periphery of the wound
